content.description: Climb fun juggy rock to a change of pace at the last bolt.  Ending is very thin but positive. Nice anchor clipping jug (kind of hidden) just right of the anchor.
content.protection:
6 Stainless Bolts to Double Mussy Anchor. (Shared with Quiet Desperation) 

  This route was bolted solely for the purpose of allowing for the first ascent, and the first ascent information is posted here solely to document the history of the first ascent. No person should read this posting with the assumption that this route or the fixed gear left behind is safe in any way or otherwise appropriate to allow for safe subsequent ascents. Climbing is dangerous and should only be done with the appropriate training and risk management practices that include providing for the climber's own safety. Attempting to climb this route as described above or by any other means or methods could result in injury or death.

content.description: This route gets progressively harder with each bolt as the blocky start gives way to thinner holds and less feet at the top.
content.location: Farthest left route on the wall. Shares the anchors with the Several More Lives to Live.

content.description:
A just less than vertical line up the center of the wall. A very fun line climbing mostly pockets/scoops.  

  Stick clip recommended.  Crux is at the first bolt and kind of cryptic. 

  There is a bolt above the anchor...that goes nowhere.

content.description: A fun slightly less than vertical line with a slight bulging section mid-way.  So many amazing pinches on this line!  Great Rock!
content.protection:

content.location: Right of The Life I Imagined

climbs.name: Fat Jacket
climbs.fa: Mike Bond (a bunch of retro bolts by unknown)

content.description:
An obvious line up a corner.  90 feet of fun.  Mostly good rock.  However, there is some loose rock on the first ledge and just before the last bolt on the mini ledge.  It's not chossy, but the loose rock on these ledges suggests that a helmet is a good idea for the belayer. 

  This route would be easy if I wasn't wearing my  Fat Jacket
content.protection:

content.location: This is the first route you will encounter after turning left off the little falls trail.  It's only about 100 yards off the main trail.  It's not really on the Walden wall but rather about 200 yards prior to Walden.

content.description: Nice slab/vert wall with five good 5.10 sport routes.Nice short hike; quality non-sharp rock. Most of the hike is on the well travelled Little Falls trail.The main Walden wall is a couple hundred yards off the main little falls trail. Fat Jacket 5.10a is the first route you will encounter and is only about 100 yards from the little falls trail.Thank you to those who contributed to developing this cliff.
